Regents Professor Emerita, Department of Design, Housing and Apparel, College of Design, University of Minnesota, specializes in cultural aspects of dress with interest and expertise in Asia and Africa

and co-edited Fashion Foundations: Early Writings on Dress

note: She was appointed President of the Jury for Award to the Finest Textile Designers and Weavers for their Creativity and appointed Co-Chairperson for Handloom Development Working Group for the 12th Plan Planning Commission, Government of India, for evolving a development programme for 1 million handloom weavers.
title: She has lectured extensively at universities in USA, Australia and India and at National Museums in among others the UK

She has written and published extensively on Indian textiles, Iranian textiles and South Asian textiles and Southeast Asian textiles. She has recently edited the Berg World Encyclopaedia of Dress and Fashion Volume IV, South Asia and Southeast Asia
where she has contributed several articles of interest to readers. She organized major exhibitions
